image.altText: A bunch of gold bars and coins.

items.synopsis: The investigation will probe whether Australia's reputation in the precious metals industry was damaged by a string of ongoing sagas at the embattled mint.

title.children: Perth Mint to undergo federal probe in wake of so-called 'gold doping' saga

image.altText: A dim, dark blue picture of a white submersible underwater, with a stream of bubbles coming from it.

items.synopsis: Authorities say the search for the submersible missing near the Titanic wreck is entering a critical stage, with fears the five occupants will run out of oxygen and develop hypothermia if not found soon. Follow live.

title.children: US Coast Guard to provide update on missing submersible

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The sun is rising over St John's Harbour in Newfoundland, Canada, which is where the Titan crew departed from on Sunday morning. It is now Thursday morning over there. If the vessel is still intact, it means the crew has been stuck in the mini-van sized vessel for four days. Experts had estimated they had about four days worth (96 hours) of oxygen, though some are holding out hope the crew have been conserving it to extend their time. There are currently no new breakthroughs or updates from the US and Canadian coastguards involved in the search.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Four days have now passed since the Titan crew went missing

children.content: Early morning view of St John's Harbour, Newfoundland.
(Reuters: Eric Cox)
The sun is rising over
St John's Harbour
in Newfoundland, Canada, which is where the Titan crew departed from on
Sunday morning
. It is now
Thursday morning
over there.
If the vessel is still intact, it means the crew has been stuck in the mini-van sized vessel for
four days
Experts had estimated they had about four days worth
(96 hours)
of oxygen, though some are
holding out hope
the crew have been conserving it to extend their time.
There are currently no new breakthroughs or updates from the US and Canadian coastguards involved in the search.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: As the search for the missing submersible intensifies, here's a recap of what we know so far: If the vessel is still operating, it's estimated to run out of oxygen at around 8pm AEST tonight But, Frank Owen, a former commander in the Royal Australian Navy, says the five crew members could have more time if they've been conserving their oxygen. The experienced French diver on board, Paul-Henri Nargoelet, would be key to directing the other four passengers on how to keep calm and control their breathing, Owen says. The US and Canadian coast guards are still searching an area the size of about 26,000 square kilometres — that's more than twice the size of greater Sydney. The underwater "banging" noises picked up on Tuesday have "yielded negative results" so far, the US coast guard says. We'll continue to keep you updated over the next couple of hours.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Titanic sub crew have around two hours of oxygen left

children.content: As the search for the missing submersible intensifies, here's a recap of what we know so far:
If the vessel is still operating, it's estimated to run out of oxygen at around
8pm AEST tonight
But,
Frank Owen
, a former commander in the Royal Australian Navy, says the five crew members could have more time if they've been conserving their oxygen.
The experienced French diver on board,
Paul-Henri Nargoelet
, would be key to directing the other four passengers on how to keep calm and control their breathing, Owen says.
The US and Canadian coast guards are still searching an area the size of about
26,000 square kilometres
— that's more than twice the size of greater Sydney.
The underwater
"banging" noises
picked up on Tuesday have "yielded negative results" so far, the US coast guard says.
We'll continue to keep you updated over the next couple of hours.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: One of the first customers on OceanGate's trips to the Titanic wreckage has characterised his dive to the site as a "kamikaze operation". "You have to be a little bit crazy to do this sort of thing," said Arthur Loibl, a 61-year-old retired businessman and adventurer from Germany. Loibl said he paid $US110,000 (about $162,500) for a dive in 2019 that fell through when the first submersible didn't survive testing. Two years later, he went on a successful voyage along with two men from England, as well as OceanGate chief executive Stockton Rush and French diver Paul-Henri Nargeolet, who are missing on the current voyage. The dive was repeatedly delayed to fix a problem with the battery and the balancing weights, Loibl said. "I was a bit naive, looking back now," he said. Reporting by AP
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Titan dive was a 'kamikaze operation', says one of OceanGate's first customers

props.alt: A white metal tube with a metal sled attached is plunged into deep blue water.

children.content: Customers paid upwards of $US100,000 for trips on the Titan.
(OceanGate Expeditions)
One of the first customers on OceanGate's trips to the Titanic wreckage has characterised his dive to the site as a "kamikaze operation".
"You have to be a little bit crazy to do this sort of thing," said
Arthur Loibl
, a 61-year-old retired businessman and adventurer from Germany.
Loibl said he paid $US110,000 (about $162,500) for a dive in 2019 that fell through when the first submersible didn't survive testing.
Two years later, he went on a successful voyage along with two men from England, as well as OceanGate chief executive
Stockton Rush
and French diver
Paul-Henri Nargeolet
, who are missing on the current voyage.
The dive was repeatedly delayed to fix a problem with the battery and the balancing weights, Loibl said.
"I was a bit naive, looking back now," he said.
Reporting by AP

image.altText: a man in glasses with a bald head in a suit delivers a speech to parliament.

items.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton warns the federal government it should abandon the Voice referendum if it is unconvinced the "yes" campaign will succeed.

title.children: Dutton calls for Voice referendum to be abandoned if government isn't confident of success

image.altText: A sign outside Banksia Hill Detention Centre with a police officer nearby.

items.synopsis: The WA government announces what it calls a "fresh start" for the state’s troubled youth justice system, including more guards from adult prisons at Banksia Hill and greater Aboriginal engagement.

title.children: The WA government has promised a 'fresh start' for youth justice, but not everyone is pleased

image.altText: Lisa Cloud stands in her kitchen

items.synopsis: Lisa Cloud admits she has been lucky to avoid Western Australia's rental crisis. Now, a plan to turn her home into a hotel has left her distraught.

title.children: Margaret River locals heartbroken as hotel set to replace homes in town centre

image.altText: A head shot of a man in police uniform

items.synopsis: Australian Federal Police commissioner Reece Kershaw was directly involved in meetings with PwC partner Mick Fuller, the former NSW police chief, to discuss a $750,000 contract awarded without a tender.

title.children: AFP commissioner accused of failing to declare conflict of interest after meetings with PwC 'friend'

image.altText: The outside of a large building with a sign that says Auckland City Hospital.

items.synopsis: An algorithm that takes into account factors including a patient's ethnicity to help determine where they should be placed on a surgery waitlist sparks debate in New Zealand.

title.children: New Zealand debates whether ethnicity should be a factor for surgery waitlists

image.altText: Mining haul trucks operating inside an open cut gold mine.

items.synopsis: Northern Star Resources approves a $1.5 billion expansion to its Fimiston Mill in the West Australian Goldfields, paving the way for the miner to join the world's top five gold producers.

title.children: Northern Star Resources greenlights billion-dollar KCGM Super Pit upgrade

image.altText: A Geelong AFL player lies on a mobile stretcher with a neckbrace and a trainer supporting his head.

items.synopsis: Geelong star Jeremy Cameron is taken to hospital after a collision with a teammate - his Cats team and the Demons are in a tight, low-scoring encounter in the rain at Kardinia Park. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Game in the balance between Cats, Demons as Cameron taken to hospital after collision

image.altText: A cricket trophy sits on top a pedestal which has the words 'Women's Ashes' on it and clouds, sky and light-towers behind it.

items.synopsis: Australia's bid to defend the Women's Ashes gets under way with a one-off Test against England at Trent Bridge. Check out the live scores and stats in our ScoreCentre.

title.children: Women's Ashes live: Australia wins toss and bats in one-off Test to start series at Trent Bridge

image.altText: Businessman Yevgeny Prigozhin, left, stands next to Vladimir Putin and other men.

items.synopsis: As Russia moves to take control of Wagner with its push for recruits to sign contracts before July 1, Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of the mercenary group, has vowed a boycott. Now everyone is waiting to see if he will ultimately bend to the Russian leader's will — and what happens if he refuses.

title.children: Putin appears to be feuding with his only friend. But nothing inside the Kremlin is as it seems

image.altText: three images of a woman as an athlete, doctor and army training

items.synopsis: Jana Pittman is a world champion, doctor and mother - and suffers incontinence. She's one of the five million Australians that have continence issues.

title.children: Jana Pittman would tip water on herself every race to hide the fact she'd wet herself: She's not ashamed any more

image.altText: picture of two men and a woman looking at a book inside a room

items.synopsis: US President Joe Biden and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are set to deepen defence and technology cooperation between their countries during Modi's official visit to the White House, despite lingering concerns about human rights in India.

title.children: India, US set to deepen defence ties as Modi meets Biden in the White House

image.altText: An astronaut in space above Earth

items.synopsis: New research shows travelling in space dials down the activity of genes in white blood cells that are crucial to the immune system.

title.children: Study reveals how immune system of astronauts breaks down

image.altText: Train wagons piled up after an incident

items.synopsis: Rio Tinto re-opens a rail line in northern Western Australia that was damaged after the derailment of a driverless train.

title.children: Major miner reveals damage caused by Pilbara train derailment as track reopens

image.altText: A white submersible vessel floating on a platform on water.

items.synopsis: A few days after a submersible with five people aboard has gone missing, a Canadian surveillance vessel has detected underwater noises, more narrowly defining the search area for rescue crews. But the question remains whether the noises came from the tourist submarine.

title.children: How likely is it that the noises detected underwater are coming from inside the missing Titanic tourist submersible?

image.altText: An anonymous outline of a woman with signs from the Hidden Valley community in the background.

items.synopsis: The coroner hears how emergency services received seven calls in one night from a woman, six weeks before she was killed by her partner.

title.children: 'I don’t want to die': Harrowing emergency calls played to domestic violence inquest

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair sits at a dining table looking at baby ultrasound pictures, with an indoor plant behind her.

items.synopsis: Nineteen weeks into her pregnancy, Chloe was told her baby would not survive longer than a month. She says WA's proposed new abortion laws would have made a painful journey easier.

title.children: Chloe faced a painful journey to get an abortion. She hopes new laws will make the process less stressful for others

image.altText: An image of a Belgian shepherd dog.

items.synopsis: The Colombian military leaves 70 soldiers in the Amazon jungle to look for a beloved search dog who helped them rescue a group of missing children earlier this month.

title.children: Colombian military searches for rescue dog that helped find lost Amazon kids

image.altText: picture of firefighters in action

items.synopsis: Cooking gas causes a massive explosion at a barbecue restaurant in north-west China, killing 31 people and injuring seven others during national celebrations on the eve of a long-weekend holiday.

title.children: Thirty-one dead in Chinese barbeque restaurant explosion

image.altText: A serious looking, balding man in a suit.

items.synopsis: As Australia readies for a referendum on an Indigenous Voice to Parliament, the electoral commissioner is worried by an increase in social media users spreading misinformation and threatening polling staff.

title.children: Polling staff branded 'vote thieves' as AEC reveals rise in online abuse, misinformation around voting process

image.altText: Lab-grown chicken on a plate with vegetables.

items.synopsis: The meat is made in tanks by cultivating and feeding cells from a living animal or a fertilised egg.

title.children: Lab-grown chicken to make restaurant debut in US

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Genders and Janet with photos of building defects in the background.

items.synopsis: It's the biggest investment most people make, but in the "buyer beware" market, what you see is not always what you get, as these people found out.

title.children: Most of the buildings on Janet's new property are illegal. She says she didn't know

image.altText: An elderly man in glasses sits in front of a blank wall.

items.synopsis: Gerald Ridsdale appeared via video link from St John's Hospital at Port Phillip Prison, appearing very frail and significantly weaker than the last time he appeared in front of the court.

title.children: Fresh charge and guilty plea from one of Australia's most prolific paedophile priests

image.altText: Cars and tow trucks from aerial view.

items.synopsis: Victoria Police have been pursuing two young males through Melbourne's CBD, alleged to have been involved in multiple carjackings and an aggravated burglary.

title.children: Police continue Melbourne manhunt for alleged carjackers who remain armed and on the run

image.altText: A large lake with vegetarian and logs around the edge.

items.synopsis: Police say the girls were being towed behind a boat on an inflatable when they died in the crash at Lake Keepit in December 2022.

title.children: Man charged over deaths of two teenage girls in NSW boat crash

image.altText: a wide shot of a housing estate showing multiple properties

items.synopsis: New research suggests Australia's housing market will continue to recover from the 2022 downturn and reach new high prices by mid-next year, while more interest rate rises are likely on the way in the US and England. Look back on the day's developments with our blog.

title.children: House prices to reach new record in coming financial year, rate hikes likely in US and UK, ASX dives 1.6pc at close — as it happened

image.altText: Three photo show the progression of baby Jarrod's illness. He gets more pale and has a red rash around his mouth.

items.synopsis: Senior staff at Caboolture Hospital had apologised to the child's parents after his condition was misdiagnosed and he was not admitted.

title.children: Investigation launched into hospital's treatment of baby with potentially life-threatening infection

image.altText: South Coast Labour Council secretary Arthur Rorris speaks with Vaisakh Usha at the door of Adithya Kerala restaurant in Nowra.

items.synopsis: The Federal Court orders a New South Wales restaurateur to compensate two men over "egregious and flagrant" contraventions of the Fair Work Act.

title.children: International chefs underpaid by employer to receive $200k after wage dispute

image.altText: Nurses and doctor pictured during medical procedure, generic image.

items.synopsis: Nurses hired during the pandemic now stand to lose their jobs with no money set aside to cover their temporary contracts past mid-2025, and the NSW Labor government yet to commit to keeping the positions.

title.children: Over 1,100 nursing jobs face the axe as money runs out

image.altText: Julian Sands

items.synopsis: The eighth search for missing actor Julian Sands on Southern California's massive Mount Baldy has been unsuccessful.

title.children: New search for actor Julian Sands unsuccessful as family remembers 'bright memories'

image.altText: An alarmed woman wearing a bikini on a beach stands up as a dingo looks at her bottom.

items.synopsis: A young boy is the latest to fall prey to a dingo on K'gari, where thousands of tourists are expected to flock for the mid-year break. Authorities say the animals are exhibiting a concerning "level of dominance".

title.children: Boy, 10, dragged under water by dingo after French tourist, others attacked on K'gari (Fraser Island)

image.altText: Taylor Swift – slim, with straight blonde hair and wearing a legless leotard – sings into a mic during a live performance.

items.synopsis: Much to the disappointment of Swifties in the Sunshine State, Brisbane will miss out on the superstar's Eras tour. A stadium manager explains why.

title.children: Brisbane was 'definitely holding dates' at huge stadium for Taylor Swift, but she's not coming. Here's why

image.altText: Bhagavan "Doc" Antle with a tiger

items.synopsis: A jury convicts a wild animal trainer who featured in the popular Netflix series Tiger King of wildlife trafficking in Virginia.

title.children: Tiger King star, zoo owner convicted of wildlife trafficking

image.altText: A view from above of a field filled woth dirt and grass.

items.synopsis: The sanctuary, made up of ditches and burial mounds in the central Netherlands, is believed to have served a similar purpose to England's famous stone circle.

title.children: Archaeologists discover Stonehenge-like 4,000-year-old sanctuary in the Netherlands
